intro: Machaerina gunnii, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Machaerina gunnii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
